clinical_study.brief_title: An Online System to Improve Diabetes Self-Care
clinical_study.official_title: D-STAR (Diabetes-System To Access Records): An Online Patient Portal to Improve and Sustain Diabetes Self-Care

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if an online program for patients with diabetes helps patients improve their self-care (how they take their medications, what they eat, how much they exercise, and whether they smoke).

primary_outcome.measure: Composite measure of diabetes self-care activities, developed from the Summary of Diabetes Self-Care Measure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Surveys at baseline, 3 months, and 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualitative assessment of the program by patients and medical staff
Biological markers of diabetes care (hemoglobin A1c, blood pressure, LDL cholesterol)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Incidentally obtained over 9 months of care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes mellitus
- Has access to Internet
- Has e-mail address
- Established patient at one of four participating practices at University of Colorado Hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-English speaking
